entries.meaning: The name of the Latin-script letter V.
examples: Gussa-Merry-Mingo-Pip-Perry-Pingo is the name of the little old man who looks after the aitch-oh-vee-ee-ar-cee-ay-ar-pee-ee-tee-blank-ar-eye-dee-ee-ess.

entries.meaning: Something with the shape of the letter V.
examples: The river leapt and rippled like a lizard. Geese flew over in a vee, crying to the sky.

entries.meaning: (cricket) The arc of the field, forward of the batsman, from cover to midwicket, in which drives are played.
A polyamorous relationship between three people, in which one person has two partners who are not themselves romantically or sexually involved.

verbs.description: vee (third-person singular simple present vees, present participle veeing, simple past and past participle veed)

entries.meaning: To form something into a "v" shape, particularly as part of a welding, machining, or manufacturing process.
examples: As the metal melts it is veed out with the paddle for about 2 in.
